        Parameters:
        o - The object whose class we want to render.
        Returns:
        A readable class type name, or null if parameter is null.

      • getReadableClassName

        public static String getReadableClassName(String className)
        Converts the specified class name to a readable form when class name is a special construct like "[[Z".
        Example:

        getReadableClassName("java.lang.Object"); // Returns "java.lang.Object" getReadableClassName("boolean"); // Returns "boolean" getReadableClassName("[Z"); // Returns "boolean[]" getReadableClassName("[[Z"); // Returns "boolean[][]" getReadableClassName("[Ljava.lang.Object;"); // Returns "java.lang.Object[]" getReadableClassName(null); // Returns null

        Parameters:
        className - The class name.
        Returns:
        A readable class type name, or null if parameter is null.

      • getClassFromReadableName

        public static Class<?> getClassFromReadableName(ClassLoader cl,
                                                String name)
                                         throws ClassNotFoundException
        Converts the string generated by getReadableClassName(Class) back into a Class.

        Generics are stripped from the string since they cannot be converted to a class.

        Parameters:
        cl - The classloader to use to load the class.
        name - The readable class name.
        Returns:
        The class object.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException

      • getMethodSignature

        public static String getMethodSignature(Method m)
        Returns the signature of the specified method.

        For no-arg methods, the signature will be a simple string such as "toString". For methods with one or more args, the arguments will be fully-qualified class names (e.g. "append(java.util.StringBuilder,boolean)")

        Parameters:
        m - The methods to get the signature on.
        Returns:
        The methods signature.

        public static Class<?> getPrimitiveWrapper(Class<?> c)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getAnnotations

        public static <T extends Annotation> List<T> getAnnotations(Class<T> a,
                                                            Method m,
                                                            boolean searchParentMethods,
                                                            boolean searchReturnType,
                                                            boolean parentFirst)
        Returns all annotations of the specified type defined on the specified method.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation to search for.
        m - The method to find the annotation on.
        searchParentMethods - If true, searches methods with the same signature on the parent classes or interfaces.
        searchReturnType - If true, searches the return type on the method for the specified annotation.
        parentFirst - If true, returns the results in parent-to-child order.
        Returns:
        A list of all matching annotations found, or an empty list if none found.

        public static <T extends Annotation> List<T> getAnnotations(Class<T> a,
                                                            Method m)
        Shortcut for calling getAnnotations(a, m, true, true, false);

        Annotations are ordered method first, then return class, then return superclasses.

        Parameters:
        a - The annotation to look for.
        m - The method being inspected.
        Returns:
        All instances of the annotation with the

      • getAnnotation

        public static <T extends Annotation> T getAnnotation(Class<T> a,
                                                     Method m,
                                                     boolean searchParentMethods,
                                                     boolean searchReturnType)
        Finds the annotation of the specified type defined on the specified method.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation to search for.
        m - The method to find the annotation on.
        searchParentMethods - If true, searches methods with the same signature on the parent classes or interfaces.
        The search is performed in child-to-parent order.
        searchReturnType - If true, searches the return type on the method for the specified annotation.
        Returns:
        The annotation if found, or null if not.

      • getAnnotations

        public static <T extends Annotation> List<T> getAnnotations(Class<T> a,
                                                            Method m,
                                                            int index,
                                                            boolean searchParentMethods,
                                                            boolean searchArgType,
                                                            boolean parentFirst)

        searchArgType - If true, searches the argument type for the specified annotation.
        parentFirst - If true, returns the results in parent-to-child order.
        Returns:
        A list of all matching annotations found, or an empty list if none found.

      • findMatchingMethods

        public static List<Method> findMatchingMethods(Method m)
        Given a specific method, finds all declared methods with the same name and arguments on all superclasses and interfaces.
        Parameters:
        m - The method to find matches against.
        Returns:
        All matching methods including the input method itself. Methods are ordered from child-to-parent order.

      • findNoArgConstructor

        public static final <T> Constructor<T> findNoArgConstructor(Class<T> c,
                                                            Visibility v)
        Locates the no-arg constructor for the specified class.

        Constructor must match the visibility requirements specified by parameter 'v'. If class is abstract, always returns null. Note that this also returns the 1-arg constructor for non-static member classes.

        Parameters:
        c - The class from which to locate the no-arg constructor.
        v - The minimum visibility.
        Returns:
        The constructor, or null if no no-arg constructor exists with the required visibility.

      • resolveParameterType

        public static Class<?> resolveParameterType(Class<?> c,
                                            int index,
                                            Class<?> oc)
        Finds the real parameter type of the specified class.
        Parameters:
        c - The class containing the parameters (e.g. PojoSwap<T,S>)
        index - The zero-based index of the parameter to resolve.
        oc - The class we're trying to resolve the parameter type for.
        Returns:
        The resolved real class.

      • invokeMethodFuzzy

        public static Object invokeMethodFuzzy(Method m,
                                       Object pojo,
                                       Object... args)
                                throws Exception
        Invokes the specified method using fuzzy-arg matching.

        Arguments will be matched to the parameters based on the parameter types.
        Arguments can be in any order.
        Extra arguments will be ignored.
        Missing arguments will be left null.

        Note that this only works for methods that have distinguishable argument types.
        It's not going to work on methods with generic argument types like Object

        Parameters:
        m - The method being called.
        pojo - The POJO the method is being called on.
        Can be null for static methods.
        args - The arguments to pass to the method.
        Returns:
        The results of the method invocation.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • invokeConstructorFuzzy

        public static <T> T invokeConstructorFuzzy(Constructor<T> c,
                                           Object... args)
                                    throws Exception
        Invokes the specified constructor using fuzzy-arg matching.

        Arguments will be matched to the parameters based on the parameter types.
        Arguments can be in any order.
        Extra arguments will be ignored.
        Missing arguments will be left null.

        Note that this only works for constructors that have distinguishable argument types.
        It's not going to work on constructors with generic argument types like Object

        Parameters:
        c - The constructor being called.
        args - The arguments to pass to the constructor.
        Returns:
        The results of the method invocation.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • findPublicMethod

        public static Method findPublicMethod(Class<?> c,
                                      String name,
                                      Class<?> returnType,
                                      Class<?>... argTypes)
        Finds a public method with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        c - The class to look for the method.
        name - The method name.
        returnType - The return type of the method. Can be a super type of the actual return type. For example, if the actual return type is CharSequence, then Object will match but String will not.
        argTypes - The argument types of the method. Can be subtypes of the actual parameter types. For example, if the parameter type is CharSequence, then String will match but Object will not.
        Returns:
        The matched method, or null if no match was found.

      • findPublicConstructor

        public static <T> Constructor<T> findPublicConstructor(Class<T> c,
                                                       boolean fuzzyArgs,
                                                       Class<?>... argTypes)
        Finds a public constructor with the specified parameters without throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        c - The class to search for a constructor.
        fuzzyArgs - Use fuzzy-arg matching. Find a constructor that best matches the specified args.
        argTypes - The argument types in the constructor. Can be subtypes of the actual constructor argument types.
        Returns:
        The matching constructor, or null if constructor could not be found.

        public static <T> Constructor<T> findConstructor(Class<T> c,
                                                 Visibility vis,
                                                 boolean fuzzyArgs,
                                                 Class<?>... argTypes)
        Finds a constructor with the specified parameters without throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        c - The class to search for a constructor.
        vis - The minimum visibility.
        fuzzyArgs - Use fuzzy-arg matching. Find a constructor that best matches the specified args.
        argTypes - The argument types in the constructor. Can be subtypes of the actual constructor argument types.
        Returns:
        The matching constructor, or null if constructor could not be found.

                                 Class<?>... argTypes)

        Parameters:

        argTypes - The class types of the arguments being passed to the method.
        Returns:
        The number of matching arguments, or -1 a parameter was found that isn't in the list of args.

                                Object c2)

        c2 - The class to instantiate. Can also be an instance of the class.

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T newInstance(Class<T> c,
                                Object c2,
                                boolean fuzzyArgs,
                                Object... args)
        Creates an instance of the specified class.
        Parameters:
        c - The class to cast to.
        c2 - The class to instantiate. Can also be an instance of the class.
        fuzzyArgs - Use fuzzy constructor arg matching.
        When true, constructor args can be in any order and extra args are ignored.
        No-arg constructors are also used if no other constructors are found.
        args - The arguments to pass to the constructor.
        Returns:
        The new class instance, or null if the class was null or is abstract or an interface.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if constructor could not be found or called.

        public static <T> T newInstanceFromOuter(Object outer,
                                         Class<T> c,
                                         Object c2,
                                         boolean fuzzyArgs,
                                         Object... args)
        Creates an instance of the specified class from within the context of another object.
        Parameters:
        outer - The outer object. Can be null.
        c - The class to cast to.
        c2 - The class to instantiate. Can also be an instance of the class.
        fuzzyArgs - Use fuzzy constructor arg matching.
        When true, constructor args can be in any order and extra args are ignored.
        No-arg constructors are also used if no other constructors are found.
        args - The arguments to pass to the constructor.
        Returns:
        The new class instance, or null if the class was null or is abstract or an interface.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if constructor could not be found or called.

      • getAllFields

        public static Iterable<Field> getAllFields(Class c,
                                           boolean parentFirst)
        Returns all the fields in the specified class and all parent classes.

        Fields are ordered in either parent-to-child, or child-to-parent order, then alphabetically.

        Parameters:
        c - The class to get all fields on.
        parentFirst - Order them in parent-class-to-child-class order, otherwise child-class-to-parent-class order.
        Returns:
        An iterable of all fields in the specified class.

      • getAllMethods

        public static Iterable<Method> getAllMethods(Class c,
                                             boolean parentFirst)
        Returns all the methods in the specified class and all parent classes.

        Methods are ordered in either parent-to-child, or child-to-parent order, then alphabetically.

        Parameters:
        c - The class to get all methods on.
        parentFirst - Order them in parent-class-to-child-class order, otherwise child-class-to-parent-class order.
        Returns:
        An iterable of all methods in the specified class.

      • findPublicFromStringMethod

        public static Method findPublicFromStringMethod(Class<?> c)
        Finds the public static "fromString" method on the specified class.

        Looks for the following method names:

        • fromString
        • fromValue
        • valueOf
        • parse
        • parseString
        • forName
        • forString
        Parameters:
        c - The class to find the method on.
        Returns:
        The static method, or null if it couldn't be found.

                                                  Class<?> ic,
                                                  String name)

        Parameters:

        ic - The argument type.
        name - The method name.
        Returns:
        The static method, or null if it couldn't be found.

      • fromString

        public static <T> T fromString(Class<T> c,
                               String s)
        Constructs a new instance of the specified class from the specified string.

        Class must be one of the following:

        • Have a public constructor that takes in a single String argument.
        • Have a static fromString(String) (or related) method.
          See findPublicFromStringMethod(Class) for the list of possible static method names.
        • Be an enum.
        Parameters:
        c - The class.
        s - The string to create the instance from.
        Returns:
        A new object instance, or null if a method for converting the string to an object could not be found.

      • toString

        public static String toString(Object o)
        Converts an object to a string.

        Normally, this is just going to call toString() on the object. However, the Locale and TimeZone objects are treated special so that the returned value works with the fromString(Class, String) method.

        Parameters:
        o - The object to convert to a string.
        Returns:
        The stringified object, or null if the object was null.

      • setAccessible

        public static boolean setAccessible(Constructor<?> x,
                                    boolean ignoreExceptions)
        Attempts to call x.setAccessible(true) and quietly ignores security exceptions.
        Parameters:
        x - The constructor.
        ignoreExceptions - Ignore SecurityExceptions and just return false if thrown.
        Returns:
        true if call was successful.

      • setAccessible

        public static boolean setAccessible(Method x,
                                    boolean ignoreExceptions)
        Attempts to call x.setAccessible(true) and quietly ignores security exceptions.
        Parameters:
        x - The method.
        ignoreExceptions - Ignore SecurityExceptions and just return false if thrown.
        Returns:
        true if call was successful.

      • setAccessible

        public static boolean setAccessible(Field x,
                                    boolean ignoreExceptions)
        Attempts to call x.setAccessible(true) and quietly ignores security exceptions.
        Parameters:
        x - The field.
        ignoreExceptions - Ignore SecurityExceptions and just return false if thrown.
        Returns:
        true if call was successful.

      • getSimpleName

        public static String getSimpleName(Class<?> c)
        Returns the simple name of a class.

        Similar to Class.getSimpleName(), but includes the simple name of an enclosing or declaring class.

        Parameters:
        c - The class to get the simple name on.
        Returns:
        The simple name of a class.

      • getSimpleName

        public static String getSimpleName(Type t)
        Returns the simple name of a class.

        Similar to Class.getSimpleName(), but includes the simple name of an enclosing or declaring class.

        Parameters:
        t - The class to get the simple name on.
        Returns:
        The simple name of a class.

      • hasAnnotation

        public static boolean hasAnnotation(Class<? extends Annotation> a,
                                    Method m,
                                    int index)
        Returns true if the getAnnotation(Class, Method, int) returns a value.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation to check for.
        m - The method containing the parameter to check.
        index - The parameter index.
        Returns:
        true if the getAnnotation(Class, Method, int) returns a value.

      • hasAnnotation

        public static boolean hasAnnotation(Class<? extends Annotation> a,
                                    Method m)
        Returns true if the getAnnotation(Class, Method) returns a value.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation to check for.
        m - The method to check.
        Returns:
        true if the getAnnotation(Class, Method) returns a value.

      • hasAnnotation

        public static boolean hasAnnotation(Class<? extends Annotation> a,
                                    Type t)
        Returns true if the getAnnotation(Class, Type) returns a value.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation to check for.
        t - The class to check.
        Returns:
        true if the getAnnotation(Class, Type) returns a value.

      • getAnnotation

        public static <T extends Annotation> T getAnnotation(Class<T> a,
                                                     Type t)
        Similar to Class.getAnnotation(Class) except also searches annotations on interfaces.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The annotation class type.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation class.
        t - The annotated class.
        Returns:
        The annotation, or null if not found.

      • getDeclaredAnnotation

        public static <T extends Annotation> T getDeclaredAnnotation(Class<T> a,
                                                             Type t)
        Returns the specified annotation only if it's been declared on the specified class.

        More efficient than calling Class.getAnnotation(Class) since it doesn't recursively look for the class up the parent chain.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The annotation class type.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation class.
        t - The annotated class.
        Returns:
        The annotation, or null if not found.

      • getAnnotations

        public static <T extends Annotation> List<T> getAnnotations(Class<T> a,
                                                            Type t)
        Returns all instances of the specified annotation on the specified class.

        Searches all superclasses and superinterfaces. Results are ordered child-to-parent.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The annotation class type.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation class type.
        t - The class being searched.
        Returns:
        The found matches, or an empty array if annotation was not found.

      • getAnnotationsParentFirst

        public static <T extends Annotation> List<T> getAnnotationsParentFirst(Class<T> a,
                                                                       Type t)
        Same as getAnnotations(Class, Type) but returns the list in parent-to-child order.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation class type.
        t - The class being searched.
        Returns:
        The found matches, or an empty array if annotation was not found.

      • getAnnotationsMap

        public static <T extends Annotation> LinkedHashMap<Class<?>,T> getAnnotationsMap(Class<T> a,
                                                                                 Type t)
        Same as getAnnotations(Class, Type) except returns the annotations as a map with the keys being the class on which the annotation was found.

        Results are ordered child-to-parent.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The annotation class type.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation class type.
        t - The class being searched.
        Returns:
        The found matches, or an empty map if annotation was not found.

      • getAnnotationsMapParentFirst

        public static <T extends Annotation> LinkedHashMap<Class<?>,T> getAnnotationsMapParentFirst(Class<T> a,
                                                                                            Type t)
        Same as getAnnotationsMap(Class, Type) except returns results in parent-to-child order.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The annotation class type.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation class type.
        t - The class being searched.
        Returns:
        The found matches, or an empty map if annotation was not found.

      • appendAnnotations

        public static <T extends Annotation> void appendAnnotations(Class<T> a,
                                                            Type t,
                                                            List<T> l)
        Finds and appends the specified annotation on the specified class and superclasses/interfaces to the specified list.
        Parameters:
        a - The annotation.
        t - The class.
        l - The list of annotations.

      • toClass

        public static Class<?> toClass(Type t)
        Returns the specified type as a Class.

        If it's already a Class, it just does a cast.
        If it's a ParameterizedType, it returns the raw type.

        Parameters:
        t - The type to convert.
        Returns:
        The type converted to a Class, or null if it could not be converted.

      • getResource

        public static InputStream getResource(Class<?> c,
                                      String name)
        Similar to Class.getResourceAsStream(String) except looks up the parent hierarchy for the existence of the specified resource.
        Parameters:
        c - The class to return the resource on.
        name - The resource name.
        Returns:
        An input stream on the specified resource, or null if the resource could not be found.
